SEARCH
Package com.dua3.meja.model

Interface Sheet

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<Row>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSheet, GenericSheet, PoiSheet
public interface Sheet extends Iterable<Row>
An interface representing a single sheet of a workbook. A Sheet contains rows and cells organized in a tabular structure. It provides methods for accessing and manipulating cell data, managing merged regions, auto-sizing rows and columns, and handling sheet-level operations.

The Sheet interface implements the Iterable<Row> interface, allowing iteration over all rows in the sheet. It also supports an event system through which subscribers can receive notifications about changes to the sheet.

Units:

  • All physical lengths exposed by the model API (column widths, row heights, default sizes, and cell content dimensions) are measured in typographical points (1/72 inch).
  • Zoom is a unitless factor where 1.0 corresponds to 100%.
  • Row and column indices are 0-based.
See Also:
  • Row
  • Cell
  • Workbook

  • Method Details

    • subscribe

      void subscribe(Flow.Subscriber<SheetEvent> subscriber)
      Subscribe to sheet events.
      Parameters:
      subscriber - the subscriber to receive events
      See Also:
      • unsubscribe(Flow.Subscriber)

    • unsubscribe

      void unsubscribe(Flow.Subscriber<SheetEvent> subscriber)
      Unsubscribe from sheet events.

      If the given subscriber is currently subscribed to this sheet's event stream, it will be deregistered and will no longer receive events. If the subscriber is not registered, this method does nothing.

      Idempotent and thread-safe.

      Parameters:
      subscriber - the previously registered subscriber to remove

    • addMergedRegion

      void addMergedRegion(RectangularRegion cells)
      Creates a new merged region in the sheet. A merged region is a rectangular area of cells that acts as a single cell. The content and style of the top-left cell in the region becomes the content and style for the entire merged region.
      Parameters:
      cells - the rectangular region of cells to be merged
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if any cell in the region is already part of another merged region
      IllegalArgumentException - if the region is invalid (empty or outside sheet bounds)
      See Also:
      • getMergedRegions()
      • getMergedRegion(int, int)

    • autoSizeColumn

      void autoSizeColumn(int colIndex)
      Adjusts the size of the column to its contents.

      The computed width is measured in typographical points (1/72 inch) and applied via setColumnWidth(int, float).

      Parameters:
      colIndex - the column to resize (0-based index)

    • autoSizeColumns

      void autoSizeColumns()
      Adjusts the size of all columns.

      The computed widths are measured in typographical points (1/72 inch) and applied via setColumnWidth(int, float).

    • autoSizeRow

      void autoSizeRow(int rowIndex)
      Adjusts the size of the row to its contents.

      The computed height is measured in typographical points (1/72 inch) and applied via setRowHeight(int, float).

      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row to resize (0-based index)

    • clear

      void clear()
      Remove all content from the sheet.

    • getAutoFilterRow

      int getAutoFilterRow()
      Get auto filter row number.
      Returns:
      row number for auto filter or -1 if not set

    • getCell

      Cell getCell(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Returns the cell at the specified position, creating a new empty cell if one doesn't exist. This method ensures a cell is always returned, creating new rows or cells as needed.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the cell at the specified position, never null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if row or column number is negative
      See Also:
      • getCellIfExists(int, int)
      • getRow(int)

    • getCellIfExists

      default Optional<Cell> getCellIfExists(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Returns the cell at the specified position if it exists, without creating new cells. Unlike getCell(int, int), this method will not create new cells or rows if they don't exist.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the cell if it exists, or an empty Optional if the cell or its containing row doesn't exist
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if row or column number is negative
      See Also:
      • getCell(int, int)
      • getRowIfExists(int)

    • getColumnCount

      int getColumnCount()
      Returns the total number of columns in this sheet. This count includes all columns between 0 and the last used column, inclusive, regardless of whether individual columns contain data.
      Returns:
      the total number of columns in this sheet

    • getColumnWidth

      float getColumnWidth(int colIndex)
      Get column width.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      width of the column with number colIndex in points

    • getCurrentCell

      Cell getCurrentCell()
      Get the current cell in the sheet. The current cell represents the active or focused cell in the sheet, which is typically used for navigation and editing operations.

      If no active cell has been set, the cell at position "A1" is returned

      Returns:
      the current cell
      See Also:
      • setCurrentCell(Cell)
      • setCurrentCell(int, int)

    • getMergedRegions

      List<RectangularRegion> getMergedRegions()
      Returns a list of all merged regions in this sheet. A merged region is a rectangular area of cells that acts as a single cell. The list is unmodifiable and represents a snapshot of the current state.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of all merged regions in this sheet
      See Also:
      • addMergedRegion(RectangularRegion)
      • getMergedRegion(int, int)

    • getMergedRegion

      Optional<RectangularRegion> getMergedRegion(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Returns the merged region that contains the cell at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the merged region, or empty if the cell is not part of any merged region
      See Also:
      • getMergedRegions()
      • addMergedRegion(RectangularRegion)

      Returns the row at the specified index, creating it if it doesn't exist. This method ensures a row is always returned, creating new rows as needed.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the row at the specified position, never null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row index is negative
      See Also:

      default Optional<Row> getRowIfExists(int rowIndex)
      Returns the row at the specified index if it exists, without creating new rows. Unlike getRow(int), this method will not create new rows if they don't exist.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the row if it exists, or an empty Optional if the row doesn't exist
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row index is negative
      See Also:

    • getRowCount

      int getRowCount()
      Returns the total number of rows in this sheet. This count includes all rows between 0 and the last used row, inclusive, regardless of whether individual rows contain data. Empty rows within this range are included in the count.
      Returns:
      the total number of rows in this sheet
      See Also:
      • isEmpty()

      float getRowHeight(int rowIndex)
      Returns the height of the specified row in points. The height affects the visual presentation of the row in the sheet.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      Returns:
      height of the specified row in points
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row index is negative

    • getSheetName

      String getSheetName()
      Returns the name of this sheet. The sheet name is a unique identifier within its workbook and is used to reference the sheet in formulas and programmatic access.
      Returns:
      the name of this sheet
      See Also:
      • Workbook

    • getSplitColumn

      int getSplitColumn()
      Returns the frozen column split point. Columns before this point remain visible while scrolling horizontally. This is commonly used to keep headers visible.
      Returns:
      the number of the first unfrozen column (0-based)
      See Also:
      • splitAt(int, int)

    • getSplitRow

      int getSplitRow()
      Returns the frozen row split point. Rows before this point remain visible while scrolling vertically. This is commonly used to keep headers visible.
      Returns:
      the number of the first unfrozen row (0-based)
      See Also:
      • splitAt(int, int)

    • getWorkbook

      Workbook getWorkbook()
      Returns the workbook that contains this sheet. Each sheet belongs to exactly one workbook and maintains this association throughout its lifetime.
      Returns:
      the workbook that contains this sheet, never null

    • getZoom

      float getZoom()
      Get the zoom factor for this sheet.
      Returns:
      zoom factor, 1.0=100%

    • createRow

      default Row createRow(@Nullable Object... values)
      Creates a new row at the end of the sheet and populates it with the provided values. This is a convenience method that converts the varargs parameter to a list and delegates to createRowWith(Iterable).

      Example usage: Row row = sheet.createRow("Name", 42, true);

      Parameters:
      values - the values to insert into the cells of the new row. Each value will be converted to its string representation if necessary. Null values create empty cells.
      Returns:
      the newly created row
      See Also:
      • createRowWith(Iterable)
      • getRowCount()

    • createRowWith

      default <T, C extends Iterable<@Nullable T>> Row createRowWith(C values)
      Creates a new row at the end of the sheet and populates it with values from the provided Iterable. This is the primary implementation for row creation with multiple values. It supports any Iterable source of values, making it flexible for different data structures.

      Examples: 

      
 // Using a List
 List<String> data = Arrays.asList("Name", "Age", "City");
 Row row1 = sheet.createRowWith(data);

 // Using a Set
 Set<Integer> numbers = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3));
 Row row2 = sheet.createRowWith(numbers);
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the Iterable
      C - the type of the Iterable collection
      Parameters:
      values - the Iterable containing values to insert into the new row's cells. Each value will be converted to its string representation if necessary. Null values create empty cells.
      Returns:
      the newly created row
      See Also:
      • createRow(Object...)
      • getRowCount()
      • Row.createCell(Object)

    • setAutofilterRow

      void setAutofilterRow(int rowIndex)
      Sets an automatic filter on the given row (optional operation).
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)

    • setColumnWidth

      void setColumnWidth(int colIndex, float width)
      Set column width.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      width - the width of the column in points

    • setCurrentCell

      boolean setCurrentCell(Cell cell)
      Sets the current (active) cell in the sheet. The current cell is used for navigation and editing operations. If the specified cell belongs to a merged region, the top-left cell of that region becomes the current cell.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to set as current. If null, the current cell selection is cleared.
      Returns:
      true if the current cell changed, false if the specified cell was already the current cell
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the cell belongs to a different sheet
      See Also:
      • getCurrentCell()
      • setCurrentCell(int, int)

    • setCurrentCell

      default boolean setCurrentCell(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Convenience method to set the current cell by its row and column coordinates. This method creates or retrieves the cell at the specified position and sets it as the current cell.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index of the cell to set as current (0-based)
      colIndex - the column index of the cell to set as current (0-based)
      Returns:
      true if the current cell changed, false if the specified cell was already the current cell
      See Also:
      • setCurrentCell(Cell)
      • getCurrentCell()
      • getCell(int, int)

    • setRowHeight

      Parameters:

      Set the zoom factor for this sheet.

    • splitAt

      void splitAt(int rowIndex, int colIndex)
      Split (freeze) view.

      Splits the sheet so that rows above rowIndex and columns to the left of colIndex remain visible when scrolling.

      Parameters:
      rowIndex - row index (0-based)
      colIndex - column index (0-based)

    • iterator

      default Iterator<Row> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the rows in this sheet. Empty rows within this range are included in the iteration.

      This method is part of the Iterable interface implementation, allowing the sheet to be used in for-each loops: for (Row row : sheet) {...}

      Read-only: The returned iterator is read-only. Calling Iterator.remove() will always throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Row>
      Returns:
      an iterator over the rows in ascending order
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if attempting to remove rows through the iterator
      See Also:
      • for a stream-based alternative

    • copy

      default void copy(Sheet other)
      Copy sheet data from another sheet.
      Parameters:
      other - sheet to copy data from

    • rows

      default Stream<Row> rows()
      Returns a sequential Stream of all rows in this sheet. This method provides a stream-based alternative to the iterator() method, enabling functional-style operations on the rows.

      The stream traverses rows in ascending order from 0 to getColumnCount(), exclusive. Empty rows within this range are included in the stream. The stream is ordered and non-parallel.

      Example usage: sheet.rows().filter(row -> !row.isEmpty()).forEach(row -> processRow(row));

      Returns:
      a sequential Stream of rows in ascending order
      See Also:
      • iterator()

    • getColumnName

      static String getColumnName(int colIndex)
      Translate column number to column name.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the column name

    • getColumnNumber

      static int getColumnNumber(String colName)
      Translate column name to column number.
      Parameters:
      colName - the name of the column, i.e. "A", "B",... , "AA", "AB",...
      Returns:
      the column number
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if colName is not a valid column name

    • getRowName

      static String getRowName(int rowIndex)
      Get row name as String.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the row name (in Excel convention, i.e. "1" for row index 0)

    • isEmpty

      default boolean isEmpty()
      Test if the sheet is empty.
      Returns:
      true, if the sheet is empty

    • readLock

      com.dua3.utility.concurrent.AutoLock readLock(String name)
      Acquires a read lock for thread-safe access to the sheet. Multiple threads can hold read locks simultaneously, but a read lock cannot be acquired while a write lock is held. The lock is automatically released when the returned AutoLock is closed.

      Example usage with try-with-resources: 

      
 try (var lock = sheet.readLock("MyOperation")) {
     // Read operations here...
     Cell cell = sheet.getCell(0, 0);
 }
      Parameters:
      name - a descriptive name for the lock, used for debugging and monitoring. Should indicate the operation or component acquiring the lock.
      Returns:
      an AutoLock that will automatically release the read lock when closed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is null
      See Also:
      • writeLock(String)
      • AutoLock

    • writeLock

      com.dua3.utility.concurrent.AutoLock writeLock(String name)
      Acquires an exclusive write lock for thread-safe modifications to the sheet. Only one thread can hold a write lock at a time, and no read locks can be held while a write lock is active. The lock is automatically released when the returned AutoLock is closed.

      Example usage with try-with-resources: 

      
 try (var lock = sheet.writeLock("UpdateOperation")) {
     // Modification operations here...
     sheet.getCell(0, 0).setValue("New Value");
     sheet.addMergedRegion(region);
 }

      Note: Write locks should be held for the shortest time possible as they block all other threads from reading or writing.

      Parameters:
      name - a descriptive name for the lock, used for debugging and monitoring. Should indicate the operation or component acquiring the lock.
      Returns:
      an AutoLock that will automatically release the write lock when closed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is null
      See Also:
      • readLock(String)
      • AutoLock

    • find

      default Optional<Cell> find(String text, SearchSettings ss)
      Find cell containing text in sheet.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to search for
      ss - the SearchSettings to use
      Returns:
      Optional holding the cell found or empty

    • getDefaultRowHeight

      float getDefaultRowHeight()
      Get the default row height for this sheet, i.e., the height used when creating new rows.
      Returns:
      the default row height in typographical points (1/72 inch)

    • getDefaultColumnWidth

      float getDefaultColumnWidth()
      Get the default column width for this sheet, i.e., the width used when creating new columns.
      Returns:
      the default column width in typographical points (1/72 inch)
